content_raw: , we will use a variety of powerful software tools to design, simulate, and program our robots. Here are some of the key tools you will become familiar with: - Docusaurus: The framework this textbook is built on. It allows for the creation of beautiful and interactive documentation websites. - Robot Operating System (ROS 2): The standard open-source framework for robotics software development. It provides a rich ecosystem of tools and libraries for building complex robot applications. - Gazebo: A powerful and widely used 3D robotics simulator that integrates seamlessly with ROS. - Unity and NVIDIA Isaac Sim: Advanced simulation platforms that offer high-fidelity graphics and physics, enabling the creation of highly realistic and complex simulation environments. Get ready to embark on a fascinating journey into the world of intelligent robots. Let's begin!
